page.title: 02THE MENDIP AREA
page.content: We have to catch a bus to go to school in Blagdon, because we live in {Butcombe.}Butcombe is a tiny village about two kilometres to the north of Blagdon, just off the edge of the D-Block. We cross over{Blagdon Lake}by the road over the dam at its west end, then we climb steeply to reach Blagdon. Sometimes we are late for school if we meet the cows in the lanes. In winter the roads are often very slippery with ice or snow. Two years ago we were snowed in on the farm and I missed a week at school! In{1972}the{Mendips}were made an Area of{Outstanding Natural Beauty}by the Countryside Commission. This means that it is so special that we must take care to{protect}it, especially the animals and plants we have here.There can be no camping here and only good home extensions are allowed.
